vehicle_combat_rules_data.description: Rules for vehicle combat from the Star Wars Saga Edition Core Rulebook, covering starting battles, combat actions, attacking vehicles, and special combat rules.

details.title: Initiative in Vehicle Combat
details.text: There are two options for determining initiative: 1) Each character makes a separate Initiative check (best if most characters are on the same vehicle). 2) Make an Initiative check for each vehicle, using the pilot's Initiative check modifier (best if characters are in separate vehicles, allowing simultaneous action for crew on the same vehicle). A character trained in the Pilot skill can choose to make a Pilot check instead of an Initiative check. The vehicle's size modifier applies to the check.

details.title: Surprise Round in Vehicle Combat
details.text: If some but not all combatants are aware of their opponents, a surprise round occurs. Aware combatants act in initiative order, taking a single standard, move, or swift action. Unaware combatants are flat-footed and do not act in the surprise round. (This generally follows standard surprise rules, page 149).

action_list.description: Assist an ally's skill check, ability check, or attack roll. Copilot can assist Pilot checks. Gunner can aid another gunner's attack (+2 bonus on next attack vs. target if gunner hits Ref 10). System Operator can aid attacks via Use Computer (DC 10). Commander can aid attacks via Knowledge (tactics) (DC 10).

Fire a vehicle-mounted weapon. Attack roll: 1d20 + gunner's BAB + vehicle's Int modifier + range modifier. Damage Calculation (Errata p.292): (Weapon Damage + 1/2 heroic level + miscellaneous modifiers) x multiplier. Critical Hits (Errata p.292): When using a vehicle weapon, you cannot apply any effect that causes an automatic natural 20 or automatic critical hit (such as spending a Destiny Point or using the Jedi Masterâ€™s serenity class feature), unless a rule specifies that it can be used with vehicle weapons. Capital ship weapons take a -20 penalty against targets smaller than Colossal size (unless point-defense). Pilots trained in Pilot skill get +2 on attacks with pilot-operated weapons.

Move up to vehicle's speed in a straight line toward target, then make one attack with a vehicle weapon. Gain +2 bonus on attack roll, take -2 penalty to vehicle's Reflex Defense until start of next turn. Cannot move through enemy-occupied squares in starship scale.

Standard action to initiate or continue a dogfight. To initiate: Opposed Pilot check (-5 penalty for attacker) vs. enemy airspeeder/starfighter in adjacent square (starship scale). Success engages dogfight. To continue: Opposed Pilot check; if won, make one vehicle weapon attack as a swift action. If lost, cannot attack, and vehicle's gunners take -5 penalty to attacks.

Pilot and all gunners take -5 penalty on attack rolls; vehicle gains +2 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense. If no attacks are made, vehicle gains +5 dodge bonus, gunners take -10 penalty. Trained pilots increase these dodge bonuses to +5 and +10 respectively.
Move vehicle up to its speed. Cannot re-enter a square just left.
Move action. Opposed Pilot check. Success allows disengagement and movement up to speed. Failure means remaining in dogfight, gunners take -5 attack penalty.
Two consecutive swift actions to aim. Ignores cover bonuses on next attack.
Bring vehicle to a full stop if no movement action taken this turn. Cannot be used if vehicle used all-out movement last turn.

DC 20 Pilot check. Success: speed +1 square until start of next turn (+1 additional square per 5 points over DC). Failure: vehicle moves -1 step on condition track, no speed increase. Errata p.292: You may attempt to increase vehicle speed once per round as a free action when using the all-out movement action.
Three swift actions (same or consecutive turns). DC 20 Mechanics check. Success: restore 5 SR (up to max).
Three swift actions (same or consecutive turns). DC 20 Mechanics check. Success: vehicle moves +1 step on condition track.

Move up to four times vehicle's speed in a straight line. Vehicle loses Dex bonus to Reflex Defense. Gunners cannot attack. Cannot be used unless vehicle moved last turn. Can achieve Maximum Velocity on subsequent turn.
Used if capable of multiple attacks (e.g., Double Attack feat). Pilot cannot make full attack if vehicle moved, unless at full stop.

Move vehicle into target's space. Pilot check (-10 penalty) vs. target's Reflex Defense. Success: vehicle, target, and all passengers take collision damage (Table 10-3, CRB p.173). Ramming vehicle may continue movement if able. Failure: half damage, ramming vehicle pushed back. Double damage if ramming vehicle was moving all-out or at max velocity.
DC 15 Pilot check as reaction to vehicle collision. Success: all targets take half damage. Starship Scale: success means no collision occurs. Cannot be used if intentionally ramming.
If enemy starfighter moves through pilot's square or adjacent square (starship scale), pilot may attempt to initiate a dogfight as an attack of opportunity. Success stops enemy movement.

details.title: Area Attacks (Vehicle Combat)
details.text: Works as standard area attacks. Starship Scale: Area attacks (autofire, burst, splash) resolve as single-target attacks unless weapon specifically notes starship-scale area effect.

details.title: Autofire (Vehicle Combat)
details.text: Vehicle weapon on autofire targets 2x2 square area (character scale) at -5 attack penalty. Hits deal full damage, misses half. Consumes 10 shots. Strafe Attack (Airspeeders/Starfighters): Attack Run action can target a 1-square wide, 5-10 square long line; attack penalty equals number of squares in line. Not usable in starship scale.

details.title: Collisions
details.text: Occurs when vehicle enters occupied space. Ramming Vehicle: Pilot check vs. target Reflex. Success: full collision damage (Table 10-3) to all involved. Failure: half damage. Mobile Hazard (Large+): Hazard makes attack roll (1d20 + size mod) vs. target Reflex. Hit: full collision damage. Miss: half damage. Errata p.292: Unless the vehicle provides no cover to those onboard, any damage dealt to passengers and crew in a collision is reduced by an amount equal to the vehicleâ€™s damage threshold.
details.table_10_3_summary_note: Table 10-3 Collision Damage: Huge vehicle 4d6+Str, Colossal 8d6+Str, Col (frigate) 10d6+Str, Col (cruiser) 15d6+Str, Col (station) 20d6+Str. Double if ramming vehicle at all-out/max velocity.

details.title: Crew Cover
details.text: Vehicles provide cover to occupants against attacks targeting them directly (None, +5 Normal, +10 Improved, or Total). See vehicle description.

details.title: Damage to Vehicles
details.text: Attacks target vehicle's Reflex Defense. Damage reduces HP. Damage exceeding Damage Threshold moves vehicle -1 step on condition track. Vehicle at 0 HP is disabled. Vehicle at 0 HP and damage exceeded DT is destroyed. Occupants of destroyed vehicle take damage equal to one-half the amount that exceeded the vehicleâ€™s damage threshold (Errata p.292).

details.title: Missiles and Torpedoes
details.text: Guided projectiles. If aimed before firing, and initial attack misses, missile/torpedo attacks again on firer's next turn (-5 penalty). If misses second time, self-destructs. Can be shot down (Reflex 30, 10 HP, occupies target's square for range).

details.title: Tractor Beams
details.text: Attack vs. target Reflex. Hit: opposed grapple check (vehicle Str + size vs. target Str + size). Win: target grabbed. Grabbed target (own size or smaller): cannot move, loses Dex to Reflex. Each round, opposed grapple check to pull target 10 squares (1 in starship scale) or hold. Lose check: target breaks free. Grabbed target (larger than attacker): target moves freely, attacker can pull self 10/1 squares closer. If target moves beyond range, hold broken. Can use docking clamps once target is in same square.
